block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
COMEDY
Hasbrouck Heights Jeff Lund, stand-up. Friday and May 26. $12 and $15. Bananas Comedy Club, 283 Route 17 South. (201) 727-1090.
FILM
Nyack ''Tangled Up in Bob,'' documentary about Bob Dylan and his Minnesota hometown by Mary Feidt. May 27 at 8 p.m. $6 and $8. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
FOR CHILDREN

Morristown ''Hansel and Gretel,'' children's ballet by the New Jersey Ballet. May 20 at 1:30 and 4 p.m. $12. The Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. Newark ''Aesop Bops!'' music, poetry and storytelling by David Gonzalez. Through May 20. $19. Family Time: ''New Jersey Network Hispanic Youth Showcase,'' dancers, singers and musicians. Ages 8 and up. Friday at 7 p.m. $13. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. North Branch Sampler Series, family performances: ''Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day,'' musical adapted from the book by Judith Viorst. May 20 at 1 and 3:30 p.m. $10. Theater at Raritan Valley Community College, Route 28 and Lamington Road. (908) 725-3420. Nutley ''Sing-Along Wizard of Oz,'' family musical with audience participation. Through May 20. $10. Nutley Little Theater, 47 Erie Place (off Brookfield Avenue). (973) 667-0374. Red Bank ''Schoolhouse Rock Live!'' family musical adapted from the animated television show, presented by Running Rabbit Family Theater. Through May 20. $14. Two River Theater, 21 Bridge Avenue. (732) 345-1400. Trenton Annual New Jersey Super Science Weekend; with demonstrations, exhibitions and lectures for all ages. Through May 20. Free. The New Jersey State Museum, 225 West State Street. (609) 292-6464. West Windsor ''The Velveteen Rabbit,'' adapted from the story by Margery Williams, presented by the Yardley Players. Through May 20. $8 and $10. Kelsey Theater, West Windsor Campus, Mercer County Community College, 1200 Old Trenton Road. (609) 570-3333.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Bloomfield The Bloomfield Symphony Orchestra; anniversary concert. May 20 at 3 p.m. $5 and $8. Bloomfield Middle School, 60 Huck Road. (973) 710-7175. Cape May The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra Chamber Players. Tuesday at 8 p.m. $5 to $15. Episcopal Church of the Advent, Washington and Franklin Streets. (609) 884-5404. Clinton Annual Raritan River Music Festival: Synergy Brass Quintet. May 26 at 7:30 p.m. $12 to $25. Clinton Presbyterian Church, 91 Center Street. (908) 213-1100. Kinnelon Kenneth Riegel, opera tenor; benefit for the Friends of the Kinnelon Library. May 20 at 3 p.m. $20. United Methodist Church, 129 Boonton Avenue. (973) 838-3815. Morris Township Wyeth Jazz Showcase: Red Onion Jazz Band. Monday at 8 p.m. $13 and $15. Bickford Theater, 6 Normandy Heights Road. (973) 971-3706. Morristown We're About Nine and Scooter, folk. Friday at 8:30 p.m. $7. Minstrel Coffeehouse, Morristown Unitarian Fellowship, 21 Normandy Heights Road. (973) 335-9489. Newark Opera and orchestra; Poulenc's ''Dialogues of the Carmelites.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $20 to $40. Cathedral Basilica of the Sacred Heart, 89 Ridge Street. (973) 484-2400. Newark The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra. May 20 at 3 p.m. $22 to $77. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. Nyack Mary Lee's Corvette; performance of the album ''Blood on the Tracks,'' by Bob Dylan, in celebration of his birthday. May 26 at 8 p.m. $15 and $20. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741. Ocean Grove The Atlantic Wind Ensemble. May 26 at 8 p.m. Donation. The Great Auditorium, Pilgrim and Ocean Pathways. (732) 988-0645. Paramus Work O' the Weavers, folk tribute to The Weavers. May 20 at 3 p.m. $10 and $12. Bergen Community College, 400 Paramus Road. (201) 447-7428. Princeton The Derek Trucks Band, folk. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $32 to $42. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. Red Bank The Monmouth Symphony Orchestra; with a pre-concert lecture at 2:15 p.m. May 20 at 3 p.m. $11 to $25. Count Basie Theater, 99 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-9000. South Orange American Repertory Ballet. May 20 at 2 p.m. $35. South Orange Performing Arts Center, 1 Sopac Way. (973) 313-2787.
OUTDOORS
Westampton Semiannual arts festival; with music, dance and food. May 26 through 28. $5 and $10. Rankokus Indian Reservation, Rancocus Road. (609) 261-4747.
THEATER

Atlantic Highlands ''Nunsensations: The Nunsese Vegas Revue,'' musical comedy. Through June 23. $15 to $20. First Avenue Playhouse, 123 First Avenue. (732) 291-7552. Cape May ''Bad Dates,'' comedy by Theresa Rebeck. Wednesday through July 20. $10 to $28. Cape May Stage, Bank and Lafayette Streets. (609) 884-1341. Chester ''The Norman Conquests,'' trilogy of dramas by Alan Ayckbourn. Through May 26. $15 to $18; combination tickets, $25 to $35. Black River Playhouse, Grove Street and Maple Avenue. (908) 879-7304. Madison Shakespeare's ''Henry V,'' with David Conrad; directed by Bonnie J. Monte. Through May 27. $28 to $52. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, Drew University, 36 Madison Avenue. (973) 408-5600. Montclair ''Little Beasts,'' premiere of the drama by Jeanne Marshall. Through May 20. $20 to $30. Luna Stage, 695 Bloomfield Avenue. (973) 744-3309. Nutley ''The Cider House Rules, Part One: Here in St. Clouds,'' staged reading of Peter Parnell's adaptation of the novel by John Irving. May 20 at 5 p.m. Free. Nutley Little Theater, 47 Erie Place (off Brookfield Avenue). (973) 667-0374. Princeton ''Mrs. Packard,'' premiere of the drama by Emily Mann; presented with the Kennedy Center. Through June 10. $35 to $48. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787. Red Bank ''The Underpants,'' comedy by Carl Sternheim, adapted by Steve Martin. Through May 27. $30 to $54. Two River Theater, 21 Bridge Avenue. (732) 345-1400. Stony Point ''Half and Half,'' comedy by James Sherman. Through June 10. $15 to $30. Penguin Repertory Company, 7 Crickettown Road. (845) 786-2873. Trenton ''The Deacons,'' premier of the drama by Yusef Komunyakaa; presented by Passage Theater. Through May 27. $25. Mill Hill Playhouse, Front and Montgomery Streets. (609) 392-0766.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Chester ''Narrative Quilts,'' work by Margaret Beach. Through May 26. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 1 to 6 p.m. Second Story Gallery, 67 West Main Street. (908) 879-9001. Clifton ''A Face in the Crowd,'' group show by art students at Clifton High School. Through June 2. $1. Clifton Arts Center, 900 Clifton Avenue. (973) 472-5499. Clinton ''Barbara Klein: New Marks,'' abstract paintings, and ''How American Women Artists Invented Post Modernism,'' group show presented by the Feminist Art Project. Through June 3. Donation: $3. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hunterdon Museum of Art, 7 Lower Center Street. (908) 735-8415. Hopewell ''Double Take: Two Photographers, Two Coney Islands,'' works by Joanna Tully and Marty Schwartz. Through May 27. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery 14, 14 Mercer Street. (609) 333-8511. Lincroft ''Marsh Meditations: A Celebration of the Hamilton-Trenton Marsh,'' group show by artists from the Princeton Artists Alliance. Through June 10. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Monmouth Museum, Brookdale Community College, Newman Springs Road. (732) 747-2266. Maplewood ''Raw Spirits: A Survey of Contemporary Folk and Outsider Art in America,'' group show. Through May 27. 1978 Arts Center, 1978 Springfield Ave. (973) 275-9855. Montclair ''Dreaming of a Speech Without Words: The Painting and Early Objects of H. C. Westermann.'' Through May 27. $6 to $8; free for members and children 12 and under. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Montclair Art Museum, 3 South Mountain Avenue. (973) 746-5555. Morristown Oil-on-linen works by Nicole Schmolzer. Through May 26. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, noon to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Simon Gallery, 48 Bank Street. (973) 538-5456. New Brunswick ''Natvar Bhavsar: The Dimensions of Color,'' paintings. Through July 22. ''Exhibition: Coexistence,'' traveling exhibition of billboard-sized artworks, throughout New Brunswick. Through May 20. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Jane Voorhees Zimmerli Art Museum, 71 Hamilton Street. (732) 932-7237. New Brunswick ''Beauty in the Street: The Iconography of Idealism,'' art inspired from posters of Che Guevara, and ''Interdisciplinary Lab 1: Repetition,'' multimedia group show. Through June 8. Mason Gross School of the Arts, 33 Livingston Ave. (732) 932-7511. Newark ''Mexicana: Discovering Mexican Popular Arts, 1919-1950.'' Through Nov. 25. ''The Art of Glass From Gallé to Chihuly,'' contemporary group show. Through Aug. 5. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, noon to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., October through June; noon to 5 p.m., July through September. Newark Museum, 49 Washington Street. (973) 596-6493. Oceanville ''Sightings: Recent Works by Doug and Mike Starn,'' photography. Through Aug. 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays noon to 5 p.m. Noyes Museum of Art, 733 Lily Lake Road. (609) 652-8848. Princeton ''Imagining America: The Hidden Secrets of the Lost Colony,'' artwork from the graphic novel ''Lost Colony,'' by Grady Klein. Through June 9. Book signing: June 8, 5:30 to 7:30 p.m. Contemporary Arts Center, 301 North Harrison Street. (609) 924-8777. South Orange ''Singularity in the Communal Tide: Culture and Identity in the Moment,'' group show. Through July 15. Curator talk and artist panel discussion: June 24 at 3 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Pierro Gallery, 5 Mead Street. (973) 378-7755. Teaneck ''Alien Beauty: The Art and Science of Invasive and Native Vegetation,'' mixed-media work by Roy Staab. Through May 20. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 1 to 5 p.m. Puffin Cultural Forum, 20 East Oakdene Avenue. (201) 836-8923. Trenton ''The Best of the Best and the First Annual Salon des Refusés,'' exhibition of work by regional and Trenton-area artists. Through June 24. $2 to $5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Trenton City Museum, Cadwalader Park. (609) 989-3632. Union ''As I See It,'' photography by Jane H. Rapp. Through June 13. Les Malamut Art Gallery, 1800 Morris Avenue. (908) 851-5450.
SPOKEN WORD

Cape May ''A Regency Event in a Cape May Setting,'' conference of the Jane Austen Society of North America; with lectures, staged readings and a banquet. Through May 20. $15 to $50; reservations required. Congress Hall, 251 Beach Avenue. (212) 666-9170. Hamilton Cool Women, performance poetry group. May 20 at 8 p.m. $7 and $8. Grounds for Sculpture, 18 Fairgrounds Road. (609) 586-0616. Princeton ''Kiki's Paris,'' lecture and vintage photographs about the artists and writers of Montparnasse; presented by the Alliance Française of Princeton. Tuesday at 7 p.m. Free. Princeton Public Library, 65 Witherspoon Street. (609) 924-9529.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
